label: 阿闍梨, 阿舎梨
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: ajari, ajariya (阿闍梨耶).  According to the rules of Buddhist orders, the term refers to teachers of at least five levels; however, in the Shingon and Tendai schools, ajari is assigned generally to any monk who has received anointment (kanjō), and  daiajari (大阿闍梨) is assigned to a monk who has received the special anointment transmitting the teaching and rituals of esoteric Buddhism, denbō kanjō.
